snippet: The Somalia-born Canadian rapper K'Naan has threatened to take legal action against the Mitt Romney campaign for using the song "Wavin' Flag" during his victory speech after the Florida primary this week.
abstract: The Somalia-born Canadian rapper K'Naan has threatened to take legal action against the Mitt Romney campaign for using the song "Wavin' Flag" during his victory speech after the Florida primary this week.
lead_paragraph: The rapper K'Naan has threatened to take legal action against the Mitt Romney campaign for using the song "Wavin' Flag" during his victory speech after the Florida primary this week. The Canadian rapper - who was born in Somalia - said Mr. Romney's campaign never sought permission to use the song, which was an international hit in 2010 when it was used by Coca-Cola as an official anthem during the FIFA World Cup in South Africa.

headline.main: Rapper May Sue Romney Over Use of Song

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers
